block.p: Jessica Rosenworcel, the daughter of Willa Rosenworcel and Dr. Elliott Rosenworcel of West Hartford, Conn., is to be married today to Mark Ira Bailen, a son of Helene Bailen and Dr. David A. Bailen of Newton Centre, Mass. Rabbi Bernard H. Mehlman is to officiate at the Lord Thompson Manor, a historic house in Thompson, Conn.
The bride, a graduate of Wesleyan University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell University, received law degrees from New York University.

Jessica Rosenworcel, the daughter of Willa Rosenworcel and Dr. Elliott Rosenworcel of West Hartford, Conn., is to be married today to Mark Ira Bailen, a son of Helene Bailen and Dr. David A. Bailen of Newton Centre, Mass. Rabbi Bernard H. Mehlman is to officiate at the Lord Thompson Manor, a historic house in Thompson, Conn.
The bride, a graduate of Wesleyan University, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell University, received law degrees from New York University.

Ms. Rosenworcel, 28, is a legal and policy issues adviser for the Federal Communications Commission's common carrier bureau in Washington. Her father is a nephrologist in Hartford and an associate clinical professor of medicine at the University of Connecticut Health Center in Farmington.

Mr. Bailen, 30, is an associate in Washington at the law firm of Baker & Hostetler. His mother is a gallery instructor at the Museum of Fine Arts in Boston. His father is an internist in Boston and an assistant clinical professor at the Boston University School of Medicine.
